page.title: 12LOOKING AT THE HEDGE ROWS
page.content: We went out to study{hedgerows}in our area. We measured one hedge.It's height was 2.20M. and the width was 1.50M. We saw that it had been cut by machine and was not right at the edge of the road.We saw quite a few{birds near the hedge including blackbirds, starlings, swallows and sparrows. The hedges we looked at were mostly {hawthorn}but we also found sycamore and elderberry. We saw a man hedge-cutting with a machine. He cut all the flowers and spoilt the animals {habitat.}Another person told us about a{medieval}hedge which we saw from a distance. This hedge was near Great Plumstead woods. Most of the fields in our area were enclosed by hedges,but there were a few fences.
